Ini Asal-usul Uang Rp 23 M Wiranto yang Dititip ke Bambang Sujagad
06 Nov 2019, 10:12 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Pengacara mantan Menko Polhukam Wiranto, Adi Warman, menjelaskan perihal asal-usul uang Rp 23 miliar yang ditagih Wiranto ke Bambang Sujagad Susanto dalam bentuk gugatan. Adi menjelaskan uang itu adalah uang pribadi Wiranto yang berasal dari usahanya.
"Jadi itu sumber uang, uang pribadi, uang Pak Wiranto klien kami. Saya tegaskan itu tidak ada uang partai, itu uang pribadi," kata Adi saat dihubungi detikcom, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Adi menjelaskan, uang Rp 23 miliar itu hendak disetor Wiranto ke rekening pribadinya, namun melalui perantara Bambang Sujagad. Saat penyerahan uang itu, ada kesepakatan antara Wiranto dan Bambang untuk tidak boleh memakai uang itu tanpa sepengetahuan Wiranto.
"Jadi uang itu dititip ke Pak Bambang untuk disetorkan ke bank, dititip untuk disetor ke bank, dan di situ sepakat kedua-keduanya dilarang Pak Bambang pakai uang tersebut tanpa seizin Pak Wiranto. Apabila Pak Wiranto memerlukan, ya, boleh diambil kembali, nah faktanya saat Pak Wiranto minta, itu Pak Bambang nggak ngasih," jelasnya.
Dia mengatakan Wiranto sudah beberapa kali mencoba menagih ke Bambang. Namun selalu ada alasan Bambang untuk menghindar.
"Faktanya waktu klien kami minta secara, baik banyak sekali alasan, alasannya sudah digunakan untuk usaha," ucapnya.
Karena tak mempan ditagih, Wiranto pun menggugat Bambang ke Pengadilan Negeri Jakarta Pusat. Adi menjelaskan, dalam gugatan tersebut, Bambang juga diminta membayar bunga kerugian mencapai Rp 44,9 miliar itu sesuai dengan bunga bank dari 2009 hingga 2019, menurut Adi ini sesuai dengan Yurisprudensi Mahkamah Agung Nomor 63K/Pdt.1987.

This is the Origins of Wiranto's Rp. 23 Million Money deposited with Bambang Sujagad
Nov 6 2019, 10:12 AM by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Lawyer of the former Coordinating Minister for Politics and Security Wiranto, Adi Warman, explained the origins of the Rp 23 billion that Wiranto billed to Bambang Sujagad Susanto in the form of a lawsuit. Adi explained that the money was Wiranto's personal money from his business.
"So that is the source of money, personal money, money for our client Mr. Wiranto. I emphasize that there is no party money, that is personal money," Adi said when contacted by AFP on Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Adi explained that the Rp23 billion was to be deposited by Wiranto in his personal account, but through the intermediary Bambang Sujagad. When the money was handed over, there was an agreement between Wiranto and Bambang not to use the money without Wiranto's knowledge.
"So the money was deposited to Mr. Bambang to be deposited to the bank, deposited to be deposited to the bank, and there agreed both of them were forbidden from Mr. Bambang using the money without Mr. Wiranto's permission. If Mr. Wiranto needed, yes, may be taken back, well the fact when Pak Wiranto asked, Pak Bambang did not give, "he explained.
He said Wiranto had several times tried to collect money from Bambang. But there is always a reason Bambang to avoid.
"The fact is that when our clients asked for a good, many reasons, the reason has been used for business," he said.
Because he could not be charged, Wiranto also sued Bambang to the Central Jakarta District Court. Adi explained, in the lawsuit, Bambang was also asked to pay interest losses reaching Rp 44.9 billion in accordance with bank interest from 2009 to 2019, according to Adi this was in accordance with the Supreme Court Jurisprudence Number 63K / Pdt.1987.
